page.title: 06NAIRN:FORESTRY
page.content: Most of the forestry in our area is owned by Cawdor Estates. It is called Delnies Woods. We went to interview the factor, Mr.A. De Candia . The forest is a l26 acres in area and there are three main blocks of forestry ; two were planted around l9OO and one was planted in l957. Most of the trees are Scots pine and some are European trees. e.g. birch, oak and sycamore. The estate sells most of the timber to Gordon's{sawmill}in Nairn, so they do not have to spend much money on transport. Most of the trees are mature .This means that the branches can be cut off to make room in the forest, and the branches are then sold as{firewood. Delnies Woods is a popular area for recreation-walking and bird-watching .
